page.content: {SHANGTON CARE VILLAGE This was opened in 1973, one of six CARE villages for mentally handicapped adults in England, with cottage accommodation for fifty villagers, each with their own room. CARE's national H.Q. is at Kibworth, and it aims to provide as normal a life as possible for such people in small self-help communities. Everyone, no matter how handicapped, has a part to play. The villagers carry out their own domestic duties, grow and cook much of their own food and make products for sale in fund-raising events. The 1984 Shangton Christmas Craft Fair raised Â£1500.
